page.title: 16SOUTHAMPTON AIRPORT HISTORY
page.content: The 'founder' of Eastleigh Airfield was Eric Rowland Moon who used the meadows of North Stoneham Farm as a flying field for his monoplane. He achieved{flight}in his Moonbeam Mk.II in 1910 and probably used the field as early as 1909. The USA{armed forces}used the{airport} during WW1. During 1920/21 shipping companies took over the buildings as a trans-migrant centre and the name changed to Atlantic Park. The site was bought by Southampton Corporation in 1929. The first flying club, Hampshire Aero Club, was established in 1933. In 1935 there was increased activity for {tourism}especially to the Channel Islands. 5, March, 1936 saw the maiden {flight}of R.J.Mitchell's prototype Spitfire. During WW2 the Admiralty took over the airfield. On 15/5/1961 private enterprise took over.
